metadata.title: CVE-2015-8812 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/infiniband/hw/cxgb3/iwch_cm.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5 doesnot properly identify error conditions, which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) viacrafted packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-85-generic - 3.13.0-85.129

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-85.129').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
